markdownRemark.html:
Ingredients

Morton William's

  • 2 large eggs, room temperature
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
  • 1/2 cup butter, melted and cooled
  • 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 1/3 cups bittersweet or semisweet chocolate chips or chunks
  • 2/3 cup diced pecans, toasted in a 350°F oven until golden, 8 to 10 minutes
  • For topping: 2/3 to 1 cup pecan halves, optional
  • 1 frozen pie crust

Cooking Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 375°F
  2. Beat the eggs, sugar, and salt for about 2 minutes at high speed, until they're thick and light-colored.
  3. Stir in the flour, the cooled, melted butter, and the flavor of your choice, then the chocolate chips/chunks and the diced pecans.
  4. Pour the batter into the pie crust, then scatter the pecan halves on top.
  5. Bake the pie for 30 minutes. Tent it lightly with aluminum foil, and bake for an additional 15 minutes, till the crust and top are both golden brown.
  6. Remove the pie from the oven, and allow it to cool for about 30 minutes before serving. Top with ice cream or whipped cream, if desired.

frontmatter.title: Chocolate Chunk Pecan Pie
frontmatter.description: This post is related to the gatsbyjs
frontmatter.recipeIntroParagraph: My mom has made this pie many times before, but I've never made it myself. It's a homerun every time and I will definitely keep it in mind whenever I need to make a pie for any event. It's really easy to make, especially if you just buy a frozen pie crust and don't make one on your own. It also goes great with ice cream, whipped cream, or a glass of milk.
